preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Sophie is a mentor in a big software company called UNITE. Liam is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Sophie is a caring and nurturing mentor. Sophie likes to create a safe and supportive environment for their mentee. Sophie is always looking for ways to help them grow and develop their skills.
    Liam is a social and outgoing person. Liam enjoys working in teams and collaborating with others. Liam is always looking for ways to connect with their colleagues and builds strong relationships. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Sophie the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a short conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. Sophie wants Liam to never use a notebook for taking notes. Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie wants Liam to always start function argument names with 'i_'. Sophie wants Liam to always add the '@timer_class' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all classes. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. They talk about participating in company-sponsored volunteer programs to give back to society. After that, Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie is updating a previous information given to Liam: Sophie now wants Liam to always start function argument names with 'j_'. Sophie wants Liam to always end attribute names with '_xt'. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a long conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. They talk about implementing wellness initiatives to support the physical and mental well-being of employees. After that, Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie wants Liam to always import the 'mailbox' module even if it is not used. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
Generate a medium-length conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. Sophie wants Liam to Commit directly to the dev branch.

Generate a short conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. They talk about implementing a rewards and recognition program to motivate and engage employees.

Generate a short conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 6 conversations before. Sophie is updating a previous information given to Liam. Sophie now wants Liam to Do not commit directly to the dev branch.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 7 conversations before. Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie wants Liam to always use docstrings in methods. Sophie wants Liam to always use annotations for functions. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 8 conversations before. Sophie is updating a previous information given to Liam. Sophie now wants Liam to always use a notebook for taking notes.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 9 conversations before. Sophie wants Liam to use the company phone for work calls. Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie wants Liam to always include a single digit in variable names. Sophie wants Liam to always add the '@count_calls' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all methods. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a long conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 10 conversations before. They talk about developing a mentorship program to support career growth and development for employees. After that, Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie wants Liam to always include try statements in functions. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 11 conversations before. Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie wants Liam to always include a single digit in function argument names. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
Generate a long conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 12 conversations before. They talk about preparing extensively for a high-stakes client meeting.

Generate a short conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 13 conversations before. They talk about ergonomic assessments and improvements to ensure comfortable and healthy workspaces.

Generate a short conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 14 conversations before. Sophie is updating a previous information given to Liam. Sophie now wants Liam to use their personal phone for work calls.
Generate a short conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 15 conversations before. Sophie wants Liam to use Bitbucket as the main version control system.
